p: Therefore the objectives of the present study were: (1) To determine areas that are climatically suitable for B. zonataâ€™s potential establishment under current and future greenhouse gas concentration scenarios in 2050 using the MaxEnt algorithm [ 44]; (2) To derive host availability data for B. zonata from the harvested area layer of the Spatial Production Allocation Model (MapSPAM 2005 v3.2) under rainfed and irrigated cropping systems [ 45]; (3) To combine the MaxEnt output and host availability to generate overall habitat suitability maps for B. zonata, and (4) To develop a simple spread model for the potential natural dispersal of B. zonata using the Gaussian probability density function for dispersal kernel.
